isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - DIGITAL MULTIMETER USE - ELECTRONIC CIRCUIT TESTING

svcprocinfo.para: Some of the devices in an electronic control system are not capable of carrying any appreciable amount of current. Therefore the test equipment used to troubleshoot an electronic system must be designed not to damage any part of it. Because most analog meters use too much current to test an electronic control system, it is recommended that they not be used, unless specified.

Only high impedance DMMs should be used when troubleshooting an electronic circuit. The use of any kind of battery powered test light is not recommended when troubleshooting an electronic circuit. This can damage an electronic control circuit.

svcsubproc.title: Jumper Wires
svcsubproc.para: Jumper wires allow jumping across a suspected open or break in a circuit.

item.para: If the circuit works properly with the jumper wire in place, but does not work when the jumper wire is removed, the circuit is open.
A circuit without any opens or breaks has continuity (which means continuous) and needs no further testing.

svcsubproc.para: Jumper wires are fitted with several types of wire tips. It will be helpful to have several jumper wires available with different tips .
In the illustration Troubleshooting Using Jumper Wires , an open in the ground circuit exists when:

item.para: Switch is closed and light does not illuminate.
Jumping the switch does not illuminate the light.
Jumping the light to the ground causes the light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.para: The jumper wire can be used to check for open relay contacts, wire breaks, and poor ground connections.
